connector.description: Store and retrieve objects from AWS S3 Storage Service.

camel.sink.endpoint.amazonS3Client.name: camel.sink.endpoint.amazonS3Client
camel.sink.endpoint.amazonS3Client.description: Reference to a com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3 in the registry.

camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateBucket.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateBucket
camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the bucket

camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient
camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking.

camel.sink.endpoint.pathStyleAccess.name: camel.sink.endpoint.pathStyleAccess
camel.sink.endpoint.pathStyleAccess.description: Whether or not the S3 client should use path style access

camel.sink.endpoint.policy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.policy
camel.sink.endpoint.policy.description: The policy for this queue to set in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3#setBucketPolicy() method.

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the S3 client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.description: Specify a proxy port to be used inside the client definition.

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the S3 client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.sink.endpoint.region.name: camel.sink.endpoint.region
camel.sink.endpoint.region.description: The region in which S3 client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the capitalized name of the region (for example AP_EAST_1) You'll need to use the name Regions.EU_WEST_1.name()

camel.sink.endpoint.useIAMCredentials.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useIAMCredentials
camel.sink.endpoint.useIAMCredentials.description: Set whether the S3 client should expect to load credentials on an EC2 instance or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.sink.endpoint.encryptionMaterials.name: camel.sink.endpoint.encryptionMaterials
camel.sink.endpoint.encryptionMaterials.description: The encryption materials to use in case of Symmetric/Asymmetric client usage

camel.sink.endpoint.useEncryption.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useEncryption
camel.sink.endpoint.useEncryption.description: Define if encryption must be used or not

camel.sink.endpoint.deleteAfterWrite.name: camel.sink.endpoint.deleteAfterWrite
camel.sink.endpoint.deleteAfterWrite.description: Delete file object after the S3 file has been uploaded

camel.sink.endpoint.keyName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.keyName
camel.sink.endpoint.keyName.description: Setting the key name for an element in the bucket through endpoint parameter

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.multiPartUpload.name: camel.sink.endpoint.multiPartUpload
camel.sink.endpoint.multiPartUpload.description: If it is true, camel will upload the file with multi part format, the part size is decided by the option of partSize

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: The operation to do in case the user don't want to do only an upload One of: [copyObject] [deleteBucket] [listBuckets] [downloadLink]

camel.sink.endpoint.partSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.partSize
camel.sink.endpoint.partSize.description: Setup the partSize which is used in multi part upload, the default size is 25M.

camel.sink.endpoint.serverSideEncryption.name: camel.sink.endpoint.serverSideEncryption
camel.sink.endpoint.serverSideEncryption.description: Sets the server-side encryption algorithm when encrypting the object using AWS-managed keys. For example use AES256.

camel.sink.endpoint.storageClass.name: camel.sink.endpoint.storageClass
camel.sink.endpoint.storageClass.description: The storage class to set in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.PutObjectRequest request.

camel.sink.endpoint.awsKMSKeyId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.awsKMSKeyId
camel.sink.endpoint.awsKMSKeyId.description: Define the id of KMS key to use in case KMS is enabled

camel.sink.endpoint.useAwsKMS.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useAwsKMS
camel.sink.endpoint.useAwsKMS.description: Define if KMS must be used or not

camel.sink.endpoint.accelerateModeEnable.name: camel.sink.endpoint.accelerateModeEnabled
camel.sink.endpoint.accelerateModeEnable.description: Define if Accelerate Mode enabled is true or false

camel.sink.endpoint.chunkedEncodingDisab.name: camel.sink.endpoint.chunkedEncodingDisabled
camel.sink.endpoint.chunkedEncodingDisab.description: Define if disabled Chunked Encoding is true or false

camel.sink.endpoint.dualstackEnabled.name: camel.sink.endpoint.dualstackEnabled
camel.sink.endpoint.dualstackEnabled.description: Define if Dualstack enabled is true or false

camel.sink.endpoint.forceGlobalBucketAcc.name: camel.sink.endpoint.forceGlobalBucketAccessEnabled
camel.sink.endpoint.forceGlobalBucketAcc.description: Define if Force Global Bucket Access enabled is true or false

camel.sink.endpoint.payloadSigningEnable.name: camel.sink.endpoint.payloadSigningEnabled
camel.sink.endpoint.payloadSigningEnable.description: Define if Payload Signing enabled is true or false

camel.component.aws-s3.region.description: The region in which S3 client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the capitalized name of the region (for example AP_EAST_1) You'll need to use the name Regions.EU_WEST_1.name()

camel.component.aws-s3.useIAMCredentials.description: Set whether the S3 client should expect to load credentials on an EC2 instance or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.component.aws-s3.useEncryption.description: Define if encryption must be used or not

camel.component.aws-s3.deleteAfterWrite.name: camel.component.aws-s3.deleteAfterWrite
camel.component.aws-s3.deleteAfterWrite.description: Delete file object after the S3 file has been uploaded

camel.component.aws-s3.keyName.name: camel.component.aws-s3.keyName
camel.component.aws-s3.keyName.description: Setting the key name for an element in the bucket through endpoint parameter

camel.component.aws-s3.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.aws-s3.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.aws-s3.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.aws-s3.multiPartUpload.name: camel.component.aws-s3.multiPartUpload
camel.component.aws-s3.multiPartUpload.description: If it is true, camel will upload the file with multi part format, the part size is decided by the option of partSize

camel.component.aws-s3.operation.name: camel.component.aws-s3.operation
camel.component.aws-s3.operation.description: The operation to do in case the user don't want to do only an upload One of: [copyObject] [deleteBucket] [listBuckets] [downloadLink]

camel.component.aws-s3.partSize.name: camel.component.aws-s3.partSize
camel.component.aws-s3.partSize.description: Setup the partSize which is used in multi part upload, the default size is 25M.

camel.component.aws-s3.serverSideEncrypt.name: camel.component.aws-s3.serverSideEncryption
camel.component.aws-s3.serverSideEncrypt.description: Sets the server-side encryption algorithm when encrypting the object using AWS-managed keys. For example use AES256.

camel.component.aws-s3.storageClass.name: camel.component.aws-s3.storageClass
camel.component.aws-s3.storageClass.description: The storage class to set in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.PutObjectRequest request.

camel.component.aws-s3.awsKMSKeyId.name: camel.component.aws-s3.awsKMSKeyId
camel.component.aws-s3.awsKMSKeyId.description: Define the id of KMS key to use in case KMS is enabled

camel.component.aws-s3.useAwsKMS.name: camel.component.aws-s3.useAwsKMS
camel.component.aws-s3.useAwsKMS.description: Define if KMS must be used or not

camel.component.aws-s3.accelerateModeEna.name: camel.component.aws-s3.accelerateModeEnabled
camel.component.aws-s3.accelerateModeEna.description: Define if Accelerate Mode enabled is true or false

camel.component.aws-s3.chunkedEncodingDi.name: camel.component.aws-s3.chunkedEncodingDisabled
camel.component.aws-s3.chunkedEncodingDi.description: Define if disabled Chunked Encoding is true or false

camel.component.aws-s3.dualstackEnabled.name: camel.component.aws-s3.dualstackEnabled
camel.component.aws-s3.dualstackEnabled.description: Define if Dualstack enabled is true or false

camel.component.aws-s3.forceGlobalBucket.name: camel.component.aws-s3.forceGlobalBucketAccessEnabled
camel.component.aws-s3.forceGlobalBucket.description: Define if Force Global Bucket Access enabled is true or false

camel.component.aws-s3.payloadSigningEna.name: camel.component.aws-s3.payloadSigningEnabled
camel.component.aws-s3.payloadSigningEna.description: Define if Payload Signing enabled is true or false

camel.component.aws-s3.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.aws-s3.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.aws-s3.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
